page.title: 12MOVING INTO SAMLESBURY
page.content: When I moved into Samlesbury, I felt a bit lonely because I did not know any of the children and I could not find my way around. It was very different here because there are only 40 pupils here, and my old school has 270 juniors and 160 infants. Here we have all the juniors in one class so my sister is in the class with me. When I want to play with my friends here, I have to walk across the fields, whereas, in Blackburn, I just walked a few metres along the street. There is only one shop here and that is 3/4mile only one shop here and that is 3/4 mile away. Here we have a coal fire instead of a gas fire. Our house used to be a farmhouse. The barn is going to be a house soon so there may be some more chidren to play with. Many barns and farms are being turned into ordinary housing.
